parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.34

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Radio and Chat

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Types text to the side radio channel. Must have assigned "ItemRadio" to see or transmit the messages. The text will be visible only on the PC where command was executed. If you need the message to show on all computers, you have to execute it globally (see [[remoteExec]]) 
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>In order to replace the group callsign with a fictional name, use [[setGroupID]] on the unit first.<template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>unit [[setGroupID]] ["Cpt. Miller"]; unit [[sideChat]] "Hello ladies!";</value></part></template>.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> unit [[sideChat]] chatText

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]] - unit transmitting message

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> chatText: [[String]] - message to transmit

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [side, identity] [[sideChat]] chatText

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [side, identity]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> side: [[Side]] - side to which the message will be seen

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> identity: [[String]] - class name of one of the identities in CfgHQIdentities. Possible identities in <template><title>arma3</title></template> are:
* "Base"
* "HQ"
* "PAPA_BEAR"
* "AirBase"
* "BLU"
* "OPF"
* "IND"
* "IND_G"

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> chatText: [[String]] - message to transmit

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[sideChat]] "Show this text";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[west]], "HQ"] [[sideChat]] "Hi there";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> [[File:xChat.jpg|right]]
 [[driver]] [[vehicle]] [[player]] [[sideChat]] "sideChat";
 [[driver]] [[vehicle]] [[player]] [[globalChat]] "globalChat";
 [[driver]] [[vehicle]] [[player]] [[groupChat]] "groupChat";
 [[vehicle]] [[player]] [[vehicleChat]] "vehicleChat";
 [[driver]] [[vehicle]] [[player]] [[commandChat]] "commandChat";
 [[driver]] [[vehicle]] [[player]] [[customChat]] [1, "customChat"];
 [[systemChat]] "systemChat";
<br><comment><!-- needed for the text to display properly with the float…??? --></comment>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[globalChat]], [[groupChat]], [[vehicleChat]], [[commandChat]], [[customChat]], [[systemChat]], [[sideRadio]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 12 February 12, 2007 - 04:31 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP v1.96''', sideChat messages can be sent from 2 abstract sources: "Papa_Bear" and "Base FireFly". Use sideChat on an array in the form [SIDE,"base"],[SIDE,"HQ"],[SIDE,"Papa_bear"] or [SIDE,"airbase"], where SIDE is the [[side]] broadcasting. "HQ", "base" and "Papa_bear" seem to be the same object. The callsign strings can be re-defined using a stringTable.csv file, using STR_CFG_PAPABEAR and STR_CFG_FIREFLYBASE.  ''Example : [EAST,"base"] sideChat "Return to base!"''. 

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
